results.title: Buy, buy
results.brief_description: A wry examination of the nature of television commercials, our most potent advertising medium, as seen by the ad men and producers who make them. During the production of laxative and cosmetic commercials ad men voice strong opinions both justifying and condemning what they do. They are sometimes defensive, sometimes more cynical than any consumer.

results.title: Butterfly man
results.creator_credit: Samantha Rebillet, Justin Davies and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The evolutionary tale of Don Herbison-Evans, a man who studies butterflies then experiences a human metamorphosis on the dance floor. A warm-hearted documentary that beautifully illustrates an aspect of the human experience.

results.title: Butterfly botanists
results.brief_description: This film shows students the life process of a typical butterfly, the monarch butterfly, stressing the dependence of the larvae on plant food, the stages of development of the various species and their methods of hibernating and, finally, the economic importance of all butterflies. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Butterfly
results.brief_description: This film uses environmental sounds and close-up photography to follow the development of the insect as it goes through the stages from egg to butterfly. No narration. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Butterflies are...
results.brief_description: Two students observe butterflies in their natural habitats in order to learn more about them. Contrasts the belief that insects can be studied by simple observation with the idea that it is necessary to kill and preserve insects in order to gain scientific knowledge about them. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Butterflies and nettles
results.brief_description: Documentary on the life cycle of the tortoiseshell butterfly: first laying their eggs under the leaves of sting nettles and in2-3 weeks the caterpillars emerge and live off the nettle leaves. Then fully grown caterpillars spin a chrysalis. After 3 weeks the new butterfly emerges, and so the cycle continues.

results.title: Butterflies
results.brief_description: This film studies the life history of the cabbage butterfly and the swallow-tail butterfly, showing their habits and characteristics, and their role in nature: that of aiding cross-fertilization of flowers. The cabbage butterfly’s destructiveness and its control by a natural enemy is shown.

results.title: Buttercup
results.creator_credit: Robert Leland Brown and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: This film presents without commentary an ecological story about a buttercup which floats down a mountain stream and ends up being swallowed in polluted industrial waters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: But first - this message
results.creator_credit: Yale Marc, Jim Herzig and Action for Children's Television
results.brief_description: Presents an analysis of commercial television programs for children, with excerpts from shows and commercials. Includes comments from professionals working with children and reactions from children.

results.title: Busy hands
results.creator_credit: A Bhaskarrao, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This film shows villagers as they attend cottage industries classes held in their communities in which families learn weaving, rope making, tailoring, tanning and leather work, pottery and other useful trades. NB: Print unable to be screened due to shrinkage.
